author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Department of Art and Culture, Government of Tamil Nadu, is conducting competitions in classical vocal, Bharathanatyam and folk dance for school students on February 7.

Students in classes VI to XI can take part in the competitions.

While those studying in class VI to VII will be in the junior level category, students of classes VIII to XI will be in the senior level category.

The competitions will be held at Saraswathi Kalakendra Music and Dance School, 23rd East Cross Road, Gandhi Nagar at 11 a.m.

Those who are learning advance level classical vocal can participate in the vocal competition, and can sing only Tamil compositions.

Competitors in Bharathanatyam and folk dance have been asked to avoid film songs and group dance.

Four minutes

A maximum duration of four minutes will be given.

Folk dances such as ‘karagam,’ ‘kavadi,’ ‘thappattam,’ ‘oyilattam’ and, ‘poikal kuthirai’ would be encouraged.

The first prize winners will participate in the State-level competition.

Further details

For further details, contact Regional Assistant Director, Kancheepuram, on phone number 94432 74852, a press release said.
